lead_paragraph: Martin Irungu of Kenya won the Peachtree Road Race in Atlanta, leading from start to finish in his first time running the 10-kilometer course.Wude Ayalew of Ethiopia was the women’s winner in a field of 55,000 runners, the nation’s largest 10-kilometer event.Irungu covered the 6.2 miles in 28 minutes 1 second, winning in a final sprint. Ayalew won in 31:44.Gail Devers, the two-time Olympic 100-meter champion, was a low-key participant. Devers, who is several months pregnant, ran with some of the last members of the public to start the race. She carried a microphone and talked with a local TV station while jogging the course.
